Played this game from the very first week it released. I love it through and through. Are there bugs? Absolutely. People who abuse game mechanics? For sure. Bad killer games where you get slugged and/or camped? You betcha. But I wouldnt trade the quality time I spend with my friends trying to work together and survive for anything else. 10/10.
Its kind of fun to be either killer or hunted. I enjoy the strategy of this game!

Balance issues between the roles, as well as timed situations equate to stark disadvantages between a group of competent Survivors and the Killer. Further, the game has had an excessive amount of bugs/issues since it originally launched. The Dev team claims to have/be addressing each issue, however, many of the underlining issues have been present for years and with each new chapter update and DLC release the bugs persist and/or get worse. It is as if the company is more focused on pushing content rather than repairing the game and making it an experience that everyone can enjoy.

Further, BHVR has opted to make getting ingame reward codes overly tedious; players and fans have to watch their "Fog Whisperers" stream the game for an opportunity to obtain a code and then type it within the in-game store. This is an issue as not everyone has the time available to sit around on Twitch/Youtube and then redeem the reward (if they're even able to redeem between the limit expires) as plenty of people work or attend school, basically removing their chance to obtain the reward.

On social media (Twitch/Twitter/Reddit) if you criticize BHVR you are either ignored, blocked, or given some round about answer that doesn't even pertain to the topic. Their open bias against Killers has been made known for years and they continuously nerf Killers while buffing Survivors.

I would and will never recommend this game, unless a drastic change within their staffing happens and they begin to prioritize fixes instead of greed.

Pros: One of it´s kind, good game with a long history behind it, retains a stable playerbase and recieves regular updates after over 4 years of existence. A flagship game of a company BHVR, like DOTA for Valve or WOW for Blizzard. Very high skill cieling and the game stays fun after hundreds, thousands of hours even in some cases. The game provides a huge challenge for those who want to push their limits and winning matches can be more satisfying than any other game.

Cons: The dev team and the company behind them are miserably out of touch with the community. They do not listen to feedback and don´t care about the people playing the game and their enjoyment of it, only how much people spend, while being very bad at their own game. The lead game designer of DBD (Almo) is a shining exemple of that, bad at the game and balances things around people in his level, instead of those who are actually competent. 

In conclusion: Great game, great fun, flawed design philosophy, terrible balancing and a lot of overpriced cosmetics.
Oh and don´t even get me started on the bugs. Each update breaks something, and it will take 1-4 different updates to fix the problem, while often breaking something else in the process. The TWINS DLC is an exemple. Bugs in DBD are a whole another chapter which I will not get into here.

Should you buy DBD?
Depends. It really is a great game like no other. But buying and playing it will only validate the devs and company in their flawed ways. Objectively, DBD is a good game that is worth playing. Only when you get into it and see what is happening around the game, you´ll realize isn´t the prettiest to look at.

[b] Super Fun! 
Damn. It's really fun to play with friends, it's fun to run away from each other madly or try to catch each other madly, especially if you're someone like me who loves violence, the game becomes even more fun, it's fun to hit people with machatte and hang them. In addition, the ambience and music of the game add a separate air to help you play as a killer. Relax & enjoy the game. [/b]
